resources.title: What Is Forrest?
resources.body: Forrest is a directions utility app that calculates the most energy and environmentally efficient route.

resources.title: Why Was It Made?
resources.body: This app was created for the HackMIT 2020 Virtual Hackathon competition in the Urban Innovation track.

resources.title: Who All Made It?
resources.body: My friend Dominic Hupp (domhupp.space) and I worked together on this project that we built in 36 hours.

resources.title: What Does Forrest Do?
resources.body: Forrest is intended to be used as a utility-social-media hybrid for people to cut down on CO2 Emissions.

resources.title: How Does it Work?
resources.body: We used the Google Maps and Directions APIs to generate efficient routes and calucations to derive savings.

resources.title: What Stack Did You Use?
resources.body: In typical me fashion, we used React, NodeJS, and PostgreSQL, all using TypeScript, of course.
